bugs.title: CVE-2024-56522 php-tcpdf: unserializeTCPDFtag uses != (aka loose comparison) and does not use a constant-time function to compare TCPDF tag hashes [fedora-41]

bugzilla.short_desc: CVE-2024-56522 php-tcpdf: unserializeTCPDFtag uses != (aka loose comparison) and does not use a constant-time function to compare TCPDF tag hashes [fedora-41]

blocked.short_desc: CVE-2024-56522 TCPDF: unserializeTCPDFtag uses != (aka loose comparison) and does not use a constant-time function to compare TCPDF tag hashes

long_desc.thetext: An issue was discovered in TCPDF before 6.8.0. unserializeTCPDFtag uses != (aka loose comparison) and does not use a constant-time function to compare TCPDF tag hashes.

More information about this security flaw is available in the following bug:

https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=2334280

Disclaimer: Community trackers are created by Red Hat Product Security team on a best effort basis. Package maintainers are required to ascertain if the flaw indeed affects their package, before starting the update process.

FEDORA-2024-7d6412477b (php-tcpdf-6.8.0-1.fc41) has been submitted as an update to Fedora 41.
https://bodhi.fedoraproject.org/updates/FEDORA-2024-7d6412477b

long_desc.thetext: An issue was discovered in TCPDF before 6.8.0. setSVGStyles does not sanitize the SVG font-family attribute.

More information about this security flaw is available in the following bug:

https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=2334278

bugs.title: CVE-2024-56521 php-tcpdf: CURLOPT_SSL_VERIFYHOST and CURLOPT_SSL_VERIFYPEER are set unsafely when libcurl is used [fedora-41]

bugzilla.short_desc: CVE-2024-56521 php-tcpdf: CURLOPT_SSL_VERIFYHOST and CURLOPT_SSL_VERIFYPEER are set unsafely when libcurl is used [fedora-41]

blocked.short_desc: CVE-2024-56521 TCPDF: CURLOPT_SSL_VERIFYHOST and CURLOPT_SSL_VERIFYPEER are set unsafely when libcurl is used

long_desc.thetext: An issue was discovered in TCPDF before 6.8.0. If libcurl is used, CURLOPT_SSL_VERIFYHOST and CURLOPT_SSL_VERIFYPEER are set unsafely.

More information about this security flaw is available in the following bug:

https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=2334277

Disclaimer: Community trackers are created by Red Hat Product Security team on a best effort basis. Package maintainers are required to ascertain if the flaw indeed affects their package, before starting the update process.

FEDORA-2024-7d6412477b (php-tcpdf-6.8.0-1.fc41) has been submitted as an update to Fedora 41.
https://bodhi.fedoraproject.org/updates/FEDORA-2024-7d6412477b

bugs.title: CVE-2024-56527 php-tcpdf: Error function lacks an htmlspecialchars call for the error message. [fedora-41]

bugzilla.short_desc: CVE-2024-56527 php-tcpdf: Error function lacks an htmlspecialchars call for the error message. [fedora-41]

blocked.short_desc: CVE-2024-56527 TCPDF: Error function lacks an htmlspecialchars call for the error message.

long_desc.thetext: An issue was discovered in TCPDF before 6.8.0. The Error function lacks an htmlspecialchars call for the error message.

More information about this security flaw is available in the following bug:

https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=2334306

Disclaimer: Community trackers are created by Red Hat Product Security team on a best effort basis. Package maintainers are required to ascertain if the flaw indeed affects their package, before starting the update process.

FEDORA-2024-7d6412477b (php-tcpdf-6.8.0-1.fc41) has been submitted as an update to Fedora 41.

comments.text: This update has been submitted for testing by remi.
This update's test gating status has been changed to 'ignored'.

notes:
**Version 6.8.0** (2024-12-23)

- Requires PHP 7.1+ and curl extension.
- Escape error message.
- Use strict time-constant function to compare TCPDF-tag hashes.
- Add K_CURLOPTS config array to set custom cURL options (NOTE: some defaults have changed).
- Add some addTTFfont fixes from tc-lib-pdf-font.
title: php-tcpdf-6.8.0-1.fc41
